bibl.title: Letter from H.R. Wood to Quarantine Officer, September 14, 1922

div1.p: Ship Captain Wood requests the quarantine officer to dispose of the body of a Spanish sailor, a possible yellow fever victim.

div1.head: Letter from H.R. Wood to Quarantine Officer, September 14, 1922
div1.opener:
TRUE COPY
Schooner “WILLIAM E. BURNHAM,”
Mobile Quarantine,
September 14, 1922.
The Quarantine Officer,
Mobile Quarantine,
Sir:
div1.p:
This is to request that you dispose by burial in
the U.S. Quarantine grounds, the body of A.B. Seaman,
Miguel Vicens, who died aboard this vessel outside the
Mobile Bar, 8:55 P.M., September 13, 1922.

This request is made for the reason that I have no
specific instructions from any one whomsoever as to the
desired method of disposing the body of this Spanish
subject.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, (Signed) H. R. WOOD,
Master, Am. Schr. “Burnham.” CCD
